newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordan's king arrives with Arafat in West Bank.
newsitem.headline: Jordan's king arrives with Arafat in West Bank.

text.p: Jordan's King Hussein on Tuesday became the first Arab head of state to visit Palestinian-ruled areas, flying his helicopter to the West Bank he controlled until 1967, witnesses said.

The king arrived in Jericho with Palestinian President Yasser Arafat, his host, who had visited him in Amman. Palestinian officials said the monarch was trying to arrange a meeting between the two of them and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
The trip was the king's first to the West Bank since he lost the territory to Israel in the Six-Day War 29 years ago.
Jericho, 24 km (14 miles) northeast of Jerusalem, was the first West Bank town handed over to Arafat's Palestinian Authority in 1994 under peace deals with Israel.
"It is a very significant visit by the first Arab leader to Palestinian-liberated territories," Arafat's spokesman Nabil Abu Rdainah told Reuters earlier.
"It has political significance because it shows support for the Palestinian position and it deepens Palestinian sovereignty in liberated Palestinian areas," he said.
